trans-unit.source: Holds the security evidence for an application.
This class cannot be inherited.

<xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> provides security information about a manifest-activated application using information obtained from the application's manifests and its <xref:System.ActivationContext>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo"></xref> class using the provided activation context.
The <xref:System.ActivationContext> object contains an <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity> object that uniquely identifies an application by its full name and location.
An <xref href="System.ActivationContext"></xref> object that uniquely identifies the target application.
activationContext is `null`.
Gets or sets the evidence for the application.
Evidence is the set of information that constitutes input for security policy decisions, such as deciding which permissions can be granted to code.
An <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Evidence"></xref> object for the application.
<xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo.ApplicationEvidence"></xref> is set to `null`.
Gets or sets the application identity information.
An application identity consists of the publisher's public key, the application name, the target processor architecture, the application culture, and the application version.
An <xref href="System.ApplicationId"></xref> object.
<xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo.ApplicationId"></xref> is set to `null`.
Gets or sets the default permission set.
If the property has not been set, the get accessor returns a <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet> with a permission state of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.None>.
A <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> object representing the default permissions for the application.
The default is a <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> with a permission state of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.None"></xref>
<xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo.DefaultRequestSet"></xref> is set to `null`.
Gets or sets the top element in the application, which is described in the deployment identity.
A deployment identity consists of the publisher's public key, the application name, the target processor architecture, the application culture, and the application version.
An <xref href="System.ApplicationId"></xref> object describing the top element of the application.
<xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo.DeploymentId"></xref> is set to `null`.
